definition: junior ranking officer in Chinese army/major/lieutenant commander
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom
lieutenant commander (= UK and US Navy equivalent)

sentences.english: An army major ranks between a captain and a colonel.
sentences.chinese: 陆军中校比少校军衔高。

sentences.english: Guan Major led the troops to raid the church.
On the way he came to know Levison and Major Baxter.
sentences.chinese: 途中，他认识了利维森和伯斯特少校。

sentences.english: I sent the Willys to find out if the major's alive.
sentences.chinese: 我看着威利斯开走去找那个少校，希望他还活着。

sentences.english: The major set a brigade to guard the pass.
sentences.chinese: 少校派了一个旅把守关隘。

sentences.english: A lieutenant- colonel ranks above a major.
Colonel Prosser is over major Smith in his regiment.
sentences.chinese: 在这个团里，普罗瑟上校是史密斯少校的上司。

sentences.english: The major had retired some little time before, and lived at Upper Norwood.
sentences.chinese: 这位少校不久前已经退伍，住在上诺伍德。

sentences.english: "Hotel Imperial is the best, " said the Major.
sentences.chinese: “帝国酒店是设备最好的，”少校首先提议。

sentences.english: When the major was killed the senior captain took command of the company.
sentences.chinese: 当少校阵亡时，全连由资格较老的上尉指挥。

sentences.english: Saw Kyi Aung, Second Commander of KNLA Battalion no. 201, told KIC.
sentences.chinese: 克伦民族解放军201营副营长苏吉昂少校称。

sentences.english: He is temporarily a major but his substantive rank is captain.
sentences.chinese: 他暂任少校，但他真正的军阶是上尉。

sentences.english: Major Hasan was shot four times during the attack.
sentences.chinese: 哈桑少校在袭击发生后身中四枪。

sentences.english: They say he may have advised Army Major Nidal Malik Hasan.
sentences.chinese: 他们说，他可能建议陆军少校尼达尔马利克哈桑。

sentences.english: I mean officer of the rank of major and below.
sentences.chinese: 我是说少校及少校以下的军官们。

definition: middle ranking officer in Chinese army/lieutenant colonel/commander
high ranking officer in Chinese army/colonel
senior official/senior officer/commanding officer/CL:位[wei4]/sir (term of address for senior officer)
